headline: Five dead, including gunman, after NYC shooting in Midtown Manhattan
subhead: New York Mayor Eric Adams said police were still 'unraveling' what happened on Midtown's Park Avenue. The shooter killed four people, including a police officer, before dying of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

headline: Three erotic experiences inspired by artistic performances
subhead: Maïa Mazaurette is on a mission to spice up your steamy summer nights. This week, she offers suggestions to awaken your creativity and transform your intimate space into the stage for a very unique happening.

headline: 'Half the city lay in ruins': Hanns Zischler, the cultural memory of West Berlin
subhead: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (1/6). The actor, writer, translator, and photographer, a figure of Germany's artistic and intellectual scene, arrived in the walled-in city in the early 1970s. He never left, drawn by a vibrancy that set West Berlin apart from the rest of the Federal Republic of Germany at the time.

byline: Bastien Bonnefous,  Eric Albert and  Juliette Garnier

headline: Is there a genocide in Gaza? Why legal experts are split
subhead: Genocide, as defined by the 1948 convention, requires both certain criminal acts to be committed and genocidal intent. While the requisite acts have been proven in Gaza, legal scholars are divided over the intent. South Africa has filed a genocide complaint against Israel with the International Court of Justice in The Hague.

headline: Tadej Pogacar, a Tour de France champion weary of his own dominance
subhead: The 26-year-old Slovenian cyclist claimed victory in the race on Sunday for the fourth time in his career. He finished over four minutes ahead of his rival Jonas Vingegaard in the overall standings, with the Dane unable to threaten his lead.
